properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 9 at 3:00AM PST until January 11 at 6:31PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Washington...
Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County
Chehalis River Above Grand Mound affecting Grays Harbor and
Thurston Counties
Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County


Scattered showers and a low snow level will allow most rivers to continue to recede.
An exception is the lower Chehails river. The next frontal system on Friday could
cause the will cause the Skokomish river to rise back above flood stage.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Skokomish River At Potlatch
* Until Saturday evening.
* At  2:45 AM Thursday the stage was 16.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will fall to below flood stage today but is likely
to rise back above flood stage on Friday.
* Impact...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread
flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West
Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. The evacuation route will
be opened to the west end of the Skokomish Valley Road.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
